sen.j: 鎌田 政清（かまた まさきよ、保安 (元号)4年（1123年） - 永暦元年1月3日（1160年2月11日））は平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Masakiyo KAMATA (1123-February 11, 1160) was a busho (military commander) at the end of the Heian period.

sen.e: He was a son of Michikiyo KAMATA in Sagami Province, of the FUJIWARA no Hidesato-lined Sudo clan.

sen.j: 源義朝の第一の郎党。
sen.e: He was MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo's principal vassal.

sen.j: 政清の母が義朝の乳母だったことから乳兄弟として最も信頼された。
sen.e: Because Masakiyo's mother was Yoshitomo's foster mother, Yoshitomo trusted him the most as his foster brother.

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）7月の保元の乱で義朝に従って従軍し、源為朝に挑むがとても敵わぬと見て退いている。
sen.e: During the Hogen War in July in 1156, Masakiyo, who sided with Yoshitomo, fought against MINAMOTO no Tametomo, but retreated because of the enemy's overwhelming power.

sen.j: 乱の後、敵方について囚われの身となっていた義朝の父・源為義を涙ながらに斬るという務めを果たしている。
sen.e: After the War, he executed in tears Yoshitomo's father MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi who was held captive as a war criminal.

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）12月の平治の乱では、内裏占拠後の藤原信頼主導の除目で左兵衛尉に任じられる。
sen.e: During the Heiji War in December in 1159, he was appointed as Sahyoe no jo (third-ranked officer of Sahyoe-fu, the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards) in the appointment ceremony led by FUJIWARA no Nobuyori who occupied the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 待賢門の戦いでは義朝の長男源義平とともに平清盛の長男平重盛と戦い活躍。
sen.e: In the Battle of Taiken-mon Gate, he fought courageously in cooperation with Yoshitomo's son MINAMOTO no Yoshihira against TAIRA no Shigemori, Kiyomori's eldest son.

sen.j: 六条河原の戦いで源氏が敗れ、義朝が討死しようとするのを引き止めて共に東国を目指して落ちた。
sen.e: Yoshitomo was prepared to die following the Minamoto clan's defeat in the Battle of the Rokujo-gawara riverbed, but Masakiyo, who made him change his mind, accompanied him on the lam to Togoku (eastern provinces).

sen.j: 京を落ちる際に、政清が預かっていた義朝の姫を（敵に捕らえられるよりは）殺すよう命じられて引きかえし、姫を涙ながらに刺し殺した。
sen.e: When leaving Kyoto, Yoshitomo chose to kill her daughter, who was under Masakiyo's charge, (rather than to make her a captive of the enemy), ordering Masakiyo to kill her and he returned and stabbed her to death in tears.

sen.j: 途中、落ち武者狩りの苦難に遭いながら義朝主従は政清の舅である尾張国野間内海荘の領主長田忠致の館にたどり着く。
sen.e: On their way, Yoshitomo and Masakiyo, as defeated soldiers fleeing the enemy, became targets of bandits but managed to arrive at the residence of Tadamune OSADA, Masakiyo's father-in-law and feudal lord of Utsumi no sho (manor), Noma, Owari Province.

sen.j: だが忠致の裏切りにあい義朝は風呂場で殺害され、政清は酒を飲まされて騙し討ちに遭い、忠致の子長田景致の手にかかって殺された（『平治物語』）。
sen.e: But as a result of Tadamune's betrayal, Yoshitomo was killed while taking a bath and Masakiyo, drunk, was foully murdered by Tadamune's son Kagetsune OSADA (from "Heiji monogatari" [The Tale of the Heiji]).

sen.e: In September 3, 1185, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, Yoshitomo's bereaved child, buried Masakiyo's head and Yoshitomo's cremains in Shochoju-in Temple, Kamakura.
